meanings.sent1: The knights proudly displayed their colorful torses during the tournament.
meanings.sent2: I saw many beautiful torses hanging on the walls of the medieval castle.
meanings.sent3: The torses at the jousting event looked like vibrant banners fluttering in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of torses added a touch of elegance to the room, like a regal tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The torses in the parade were so bright and eye-catching, they seemed to dance in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Torses (verb): third person singular present of torse
meanings.sent1: He torses the fabric carefully to create intricate patterns in his designs.
meanings.sent2: She always torses the dough gently to ensure the bread turns out soft and fluffy.
meanings.sent3: The chef torses the ingredients together with a flourish, like a culinary artist.
meanings.sent4: The wind torses the leaves on the trees, creating a mesmerizing dance in the forest.
meanings.sent5: As the river flows, it torses the pebbles along its path, shaping the landscape over time.
